message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you a unique opportunity to purchase a high-quality product that I'm sure you'll love. Would you like to buy it from me for $120?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $100. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob! I can see you're a savvy negotiator. I can do $110, but I'm afraid I can't go any lower than that. It's a one-of-a-kind item, after all!
I understand that the product is unique, but I'm still not convinced it's worth $110. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $105. Can you consider that?

I appreciate your persistence, Bob! I can see you're serious about getting a good deal. I can do $108, but I'm starting to think you're getting close to the sweet spot. Let's see if we can meet in the middle again!
I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced it's the best price. I'm willing to go up to $106, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. Can you meet me there?

I think we're getting close, Bob! I can see you're really interested in the product. I'm willing to meet you at $108, but I'm not budging from there. It's the lowest I can go, and I think it's a fair price for this unique item.

I'm starting to lose interest in the product if we can't meet in the middle. I'm willing to go up to $107, but that's as high as I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to consider other options.

I can see you're getting a bit hesitant, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $107, but I'll throw in a small bonus to sweeten the deal. I'll include a complimentary accessory that's worth $10. So, the total price would be $107, and you'll get a nice extra perk. What do you say?

I appreciate the bonus, but I'm still not willing to pay $107. I'll make a final offer: $105, and that's as high as I'm willing to go. If you can meet me there, I'll buy the product from you. If not, I'll have to consider other options.
